Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel A small hotel with individually decorated rooms. I got an upgrade upon check-in to a really charming top-floor room. Breakfast a typical continental one and location is good if you happen to like Champs-Elysees area. Although I would recommend the hotel, I will probably stay in some other property on my next visit to Paris.
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveller73

Reviews.Content: Gem of a hotel in a great location       Lobby Staircase
Reviews.Author: Globbo

Reviews.Content: Great decor Stayed at the San Regis a couple of time on work. Great location in a classy area with the major designers nearby. Loved the decor of the dining room. The rooms were larger than the usual Paris hotel though still a little cramped. The staff were helpful, attentive and friendly. The food is good with room service available until late.All in all, would go back there again.
Reviews.Author: Magic_Carpet_Ride

Reviews.Content: fabulous! After a full day of airport delays and mishaps, imagine our relief to pull up tot the San Regis and be welcomed home, as only Jean Francois and his staff can do so well. A SLH member, I expected only the best from the San Regis, and they certainly delivered. Arriving late in the evening, my travel partner and I were immediately taken to our rooms to freshen up while dinner reservations were completely arranged for us at L'Avenue. Due to our association with the hotel, L'Avenue rolled out the red carpet and made every effort to accomodate. We enjoyed a wonderful meal, a short walk to look at a sparkling Tour Effiel, then promptly fell into the immaculate room, exhausted and happy. In the morning we were treated to a fabulous breakfast while we languished in our fluffy robes and slippers scented with Hermes toiletries. How did they know they are my favourite? Our only possible disappointment was noise caused by construction on the street below, which was not the fault of the hotel by any means, but this is a big city and these things will happen. I hope the construction is complete because we have booked another trip to Paris in October and we will stay at the San Regis once more. We look forward to enjoying the expert care the staff provides and the luxury of the beautiful place we now call home in Paris. A bientot!!
Reviews.Author: onecoachgirl

Reviews.Content: A gorgeous look at old France The San Regis is a gorgeous boutique hotel located in the very upscale Eighth Arrondissement. Although only a block and a half away from the Champs Elysees, it is on a quiet side street, thus providing the advantage of a central location without street noise. The public areas and hallways of the hotel are decorated beautifully. My room was a good size (I think I was upgraded to a junior suite, with a separate sitting area - the only disadvantage of this layout was that the TV could be seen while sitting on the armchairs in the sitting area but not while lying in bed). I chose this hotel specifically because I wanted a hotel with modern conveniences, but with a decor that immediately told me I was in Paris and not in some anonymous business location anywhere in the world, and the hotel fulfilled this requirement totally. If you prefer a hotel that is identifiable only as 2008 anywhere in the world, this is not the hotel for you. However, if, on the other hand, you want a hotel that could only be in Paris, but still has all the modern necessities (and toiletries from Hermes!), at a price that is not exorbitant but far from cheap, then definitely consider the San Regis.
Reviews.Author: londoner-wannabe

Reviews.Content: Quaint small luxury Hotel I just returned from a 4 night stay at the San Regis. I can not begin to tell everyone how wonderful the experience was. This was a surprise trip for my wife and not being familar with Paris I recieved alot of help from Jean-Francois, the concierge, in arranging everything. From tour guides, to transportation, to restaurant reservations to help in finding different places he was a tremendous asset to us. I can honestly say Jean-Francois was the reason our trip was so enjoyable with so little stress, he took care of everything for us with the greatest of skill, and I can also say I am a rather particular person, so pleasing me is not an easy task.The rooms are a shade small as compared to US Standards unless you get into a junior suite or better. Then they are not only lavish, but quite spacious. The soaps and shampoos are all Hermes, very nice touch.The breakfasts were great and tasty, had to stop my wife from sliding a few of the jams into her purse. She is still raving about them. We did not have any other meals at the Hotel.The location is grea just off Montaigne and behind the Grand Palais, most of the Paris sights are easily walkable. The location cannot be better suited for a nice romantic time in Paris.The Hotel itself is nicely appointed but I must say what seperates it from the others we have stayed at around the world was the staff. No need was left unattended and in those rare occasions were we encountered a staff member who did not speak english they were quick in bringing over someone who did. They were all very polite and more than eager to tend to any need or question that arose.We had a flight cancelled and wished to return back to Paris as we could not get one until the next day. We recieved an upgrade to a suite on the Hotel for this night. This was very gracious and appreciated.Overall I can say that for a nice, romantic setting in Paris this Hotel is a great value, dont read this as inexpensive but rather a great value for the dollar/euro you will spend. A better value than the Ritz or Athenee in our opinion.SGR NYC, USA
Reviews.Author: parsnickety67

Reviews.Content: Great Stay at San Regis We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel San Regis and we had an absolutely wonderful time. The hotel itself was high class without attitude. The staff were very helpful with directions, reservation,taxis, etc. A special thanks to Jerome whom recommended two very lovely restaurants to us. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The amenities were lovely and great pressure in the shower (perfect after a long day of sightseeing). We only ever had breakfast in the restaurant, but the croissants were to die for and our waiter was very pleasant. The hotel is in a great very centralized location for sightseeing, not to mention the shopping We truly enjoyed our stay here. We would definitely recommend it and would love to return on our next trip to Paris. It's obvious to me that the people who complained on here are people who just love to complain.
Reviews.Author: lmom4204

Reviews.Content: great small hotel Stayed in San Regis, for 8 nights during the Rugby World Cup semi finals  final. Due to a mistake on my part I made a mistake in not book in on the first Saturday night, but the hotel sorted it out.The location is great near lots of metro stations, shops and my favorite local restaurant The Avenue .Food in the restaurant is adequate, bar is small and again adequate but not really cut out for a session.Bedrooms old fashioned but large. In the bathroom the windows open onto the street and the window boxes of geraniums, fantastic, no need for air con here.The location is first class if you want to walk and see the sights of Paris. There are small cheap coffee bars where the local workers hang out. A hotel we always very safe in coming back to late at night, staff attentive.
Reviews.Author: dundrod

Reviews.Content: Setting The Record Straight On Hotel San Regis       Room 9 hallway/closets
Reviews.Author: parisusaparis

Reviews.Content: Truly a "SMALL LUXURY HOTEL" Truly a small luxury hotel, the San Regis is tastefully decorated for a perfect combination of class and comfort. My wife particulary enjoyed the winter garden, which she says gives the salon additional charm.The room itself was spacious, comfortable, quiet and decorated in the same spirit as the rest of the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, and it was pleasant to be greeted by name, both at reception, and in the dining area. I was in Paris on a 10 day holiday with my wife and daughter, but the hotel's atmosphere and amenities make it perfect for business stays as well.A bonus: The hotel is centrally located on a quiet street, just a couple of minutes walk from the Champs-Elysees.
Reviews.Author: EDSL

Reviews.Content: perfect for a short stay I would highly recommend , Small Luxury Boutique ...yes its is , we stayed on the 7th floor had a nice balcony with views of the Eiffel Tower , for 2 nights was lovely , staff all very polite  not snobby at all ! room was very clean , fast room service , very safe area , not noisy .
Reviews.Author: resortowner

Reviews.Content: Old fashioned This is a small upmarket boutique hotel. If you like a hotel with a few airs and graces, and similar staff then it is nice. The decor is luxurious, but in a very old fashioned way. The free toiletries (if you are one of us who takes them) are Hermes, which is unusual. I find the hotel noisy and very expensive.I don't like the breakfast service, which takes a long time. However, if you like some old time luxury, with few amenities but a superb location then this is a good choice for a weekend break.
Reviews.Author: between_u_and_I

Reviews.Content: good location The location was great. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was tired, noisy and dirty, especially the toilet. The toilet was cleaned after I told the front desk. The room smelled. The smell got worse when the heat was turned on. Now I know why the window was open when we were taken to our room. The room (5) was next to a metal door in the courtyard that was closed loudly every morning before 6 a.m.
Reviews.Author: ChinoHills

Reviews.Content: Hotel San Regis - C'est magnifique! Just off the Champs Elysees near Metro Clemenceau is one of the most elegant hotels we have ever experienced. Our lovely and inviting room was appointed with antiques, the walls and headboards upholstered in traditional blue and yellow French fabric, the bathroom luxurious. One cannot help but feel special in such surroundings. The staff were kind and solicitous, but not pretentious. All this and a convenient location. We had lunch in the hotel dining room and it was superb.
Reviews.Author: Bibelot

Reviews.Content: Not quite Sans problems... We stayed in the San Regis as part of a package with the Orient Express. As such we expected it to be a high standard, luxury hotel. For the most part, it didn't disappoint. The staff were very friendly and helpful on our arrival, going to lengths to try to book a table for us (unsuccessfully) at a popular restaurant. I must admit one or two of the staff at other times in our stay were not so forthcoming.We had been booked into a deluxe room which the hotel upgraded for us (to a suite, I guess) and we were delighted that the room was ready for us when we arrived at 10:30am. The room - no 34 - was very large, with a three-part bathroom, loads and loads of storage wardrobes and large area with sofa, chair and table, as well as desk, dresser etc. The view was out to the back of the hotel onto some offices which was not very picturesque but did mean it was quiet at night. The shower in the bath wouldn't rotate onto a fine spray but stayed on the sort of 'jet' setting.Continental breakfast (included in our rate) was adequate: delicious fresh orange juice, tea/coffee, and a croissant, roll, pain au chocolat and sponge cake per person. For any hot extras you had to pay.The lift is absolutely tiny and you will struggle to get more than two people into it, or even two people with luggage or bags of any kind.Our low point was when my wife wanted to iron her shirt before going out and we rang down to reception to ask for an iron to be sent to the room. They clearly don't have a policy on this because they said they would ring us back, and then did so, and told us we could have an iron in our room for 鈧?0! Given that (a) the most basic corporate bog standard business hotel in the UK has an iron in every room, and (b) the suite we were in cost around 鈧?00-鈧?00 per night, I thought this was an absolute rip-off. Needless to say, we declined.Overall the San Regis is a lovely hotel, in a good area close to the Champs Elysees and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Jardin des Tuileries etc. But it's not perfect (which it should be at the prices) and they need to ease up a little on the money-grubbing for extras.
Reviews.Author: JohnSelf

Reviews.Content: Very French - perfect for our anniversary! Reading some of these reviews, I feel like we stayed in a different hotel!Our room was wonderful (room 10) - one of the nicest hotel rooms we have ever stayed in (and there have been a few!) - and the front desk staff were incredibly helpful and jovial (despite the fact that they are tucked away in a broom cupboard!)The hotel itself is charming, and the location excellent. I was unimpressed by the bar area, which was lacking in atmosphere, but that would be my only criticism.
Reviews.Author: Member1975

Reviews.Content: Oh, Wow!       View from room 52 at sunset
Reviews.Author: Fpacheco

Reviews.Content: Avoid this place My room at the San Regis was a crow's nest of a broom closet that was weathered and wornout and cost $410/night. The reception area smells of b.o. The staff are apathetic, and the maids do not honor one's DO NOT DISTURB sign. There are a few extraordinary rooms at this hotel and if you care little for service and hold your nose in the lobby, the San Regis might even be a find. But if you have my luck and are given room 71, you will have a sneak preview of what coffin life is like.
Reviews.Author: Dangank

Reviews.Content: A good hotel; not a great hotel My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the San Regis. The hotel is nice, if not great. We ended up in Room 42 which had a partial-view of the Eiffel Tower and was on the street but we never heard any noise from traffic, etc... The room was large and, again, nice but not spectacular. Is the front desk staff on some sort of mind numbing drug? As many times as we went in and out of the hotel and asked them questions or for help, we never felt as though they even knew we were there. They just tried their best to ignore us. We thought the location was great -- it was far, far away from the many tourists yet still close enough to walk to everything.
Reviews.Author: SBrantley

Reviews.Content: ok experience Nice hotel, good service, friendly staff, airconditioning was anemic, was too hot to sleep, room was dissapointing, no view, asked for an upgrade , was willing to pay extra for a suite as we were on our honeymoon, but evidently they forget my request, in hindsight, we should have paid extra and stayed at the george V
Reviews.Author: huntervalli

Reviews.Content: Flawless luxury and extraordinary service We spent five nights in May 2006 at the Hotel San Regis to celebrate my sixtieth birthday. We cannot say enough about this splendid hotel. Our room was a deluxe double (#50) beautifully appointed in blue and white toile with lovely antiques, marble bath, and softly sponged walls. It was quiet, elegant, thoughtfully appointed, impeccably clean. The public rooms are elegant and beautiful without being overdone. The dining room and bar are charming, and the continental breakfast was excellent. The location of the hotel could not be better: central, near the Louvre, but in a quiet residental area. The staff is very helpful, friendly, knowledgeable, and engaging. We felt very welcomed and at ease. We have travelled extensively in Europe and stayed at a wide variety of properties.The San Regis is at the top of our list of small boutique hotels. It is a jewel to which we intend to return on every Paris trip. Bill and Andrea Clarkson, Pittsburgh, PA USA
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Dreamy Memories I and my two traveling companions have survived the chill and winds of winter simply by closing our eyes and remembering Paris and our stay at the San Regis Hotel this past November. It was my brother鈥檚 first time in France and my Mom鈥檚 birthday so it had to be very special and memorable and thanks to our stay here it was that and more. From the moment we entered the exquiste lobby I knew there was no one in the world living more richly than us at that very moment in time! The air of quiet elegance followed us into our most charming rooms covered in toile and hung with beautiful paintings. After a wonderful night鈥檚 sleep the most delicious croissants and caf茅 cr猫me got us off to a most perfect start. The concierge and entire staff were consistently gracious and attentive to all of our requests and questions, making us feel welcome and at ease during our entire stay. The hotel is perfectly situated to hop on the Batobus (or any of the other Bateaux that cruise up and down the Seine) and start exploring. After walking for miles each day there was nothing better than to return to our hotel and soak in the magnificent tub, allowing ourselves to be enveloped in Herm猫s suds and lotions and wrap ourselves in our luxurious bathrobes. One night having missed the last batobus, which forced our Mom to walk from the Louvre on the opposite side of the Seine back to the hotel, we realized that the elevator was as far as we could venture for dinner. We were graciously welcomed into the most intimate dining room at the hotel and treated to a divine repast. I look forward to returning with husband and daughter, hopefully in the very near future.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A real gem       Suite
Reviews.Author: day1

Reviews.Content: Chic and Elegant Hotel I had the pleasure of staying at the San Regis for five nights in late November.The hotel is centrally located, the public areas ( restaurant, lobby, bar ) are exquisitely and luxuriously furnished with antiques, the bedrooms and bathrooms are also well appointed and spacious, the service is efficent and corteous, and the breakfast, lunch and dinner could not be more delicious and were graciously served.I have booked a room at the San Regis for my return trip to Paris next week. I travel to Paris about 3-4 times a year, and plan to stay at the San Regis on a regular basis from now on.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disappointed   showReview(4230926, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Sandy50

Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've stayed in! Beautiful with great service!   showReview(4218925, 'full');

Reviews.Content: the San Regis - a Gem in Paris   showReview(1154650, 'full');

Reviews.Content: 銇勩仱銈傘仾銇屻倝婧€瓒?#x201d;   showReview(21211219, 'full');
Reviews.Author: 缇庛倰姹傘倎銈嬪績
